sentences.en: After all, were not his own criticisms often questionable and his tastes perverse?
sentences.cn: 说到底, 他自己的评论难道不是经常成问题,他自己的趣味难道不乖僻?

sentences.en: At this movement she felt angry with the perverse Sir James.
sentences.cn: 这时候,她是对纠缠不清的詹姆士爵士生气.

sentences.en: He gets perverse satisfaction from embarrassing people.
sentences.cn: 他通过使人难堪获得变态的满足感。

sentences.en: How perverse the gods, she thought.
sentences.cn: 她想,老天爷真是爱刁难人.

sentences.en: However tough such a demand sounds, it changes the psychological balance in a perverse way.
sentences.cn: 不论这种要求听起来多么强硬, 它对双方心理上的平衡起相反的作用.

sentences.en: I felt a perverse desire to accept his challenge.
sentences.cn: 他向我挑战,我就偏要应战.

sentences.en: I find a perverse delight in listening to traffic.
sentences.cn: 我从听车辆发出的声音中找到一种怪异的乐趣.

sentences.en: In some perverse way the ill-matched partners do actually need each other.
sentences.cn: 奇怪的是，那些不相配的伴侣实际上却彼此需要。

sentences.en: Isabel spoke in a manner that might have seemed a little perverse.
sentences.cn: 伊莎贝尔说,她的态度也许显得有些固执.

sentences.en: It a perverse and ridiculous intrusion into your relationship.
sentences.cn: 这是对你们关系的反常而荒谬的侵犯.

sentences.en: It would be perverse to take a different view.
sentences.cn: 持异议之见未免不近情理.

sentences.en: It's perverse of him to buy hot dogs when we want ice - cream .
sentences.cn: 我们要 雪糕,他偏买热狗,这个人脾气乖张.

sentences.en: Psychotherapists often take a perverse delight in criticizing other psychotherapists.
sentences.cn: 精神治疗师们经常幸灾乐祸地批评自己的同行。

sentences.en: This evening Paul had been moody and perverse.
sentences.cn: 这天晚上保罗怏怏不乐,很反常.

sentences.en: This kind of reasoning is deeply perverse.
sentences.cn: 这种推理是极其有悖常理的.

sentences.en: Yuuzhan Vong technology is bizarre and perverse, though it is nonetheless effective.
sentences.cn: 遇战疯人的科技怪异而反常, 却同样行之有效.

words.tran_cn: 歪曲的；不正当的；性变态的
反常；颠倒；曲解；误用；堕落

trans.tran_cn: 不正当的，堕落的，执拗的，刚愎的，故意作对的，有悖常情的
trans.tran_en: behaving in an unreasonable way, especially by deliberately doing the opposite of what people want you to do
